statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: La Salle 84, St. Bonaventure 61
article.story: PHILADELPHIA (AP) -- Darnell Harris hit all seven of his 3-pointers and finished with 23 points as La Salle breezed past St. Bonaventure 84-61 on Wednesday night. Paul Johnson added 16 points, Rodney Green contributed 11 and Kimmani Barrett had 10 for the Explorers (8-11, 3-3 Atlantic 10), who rebounded from two straight losses and equaled their conference victory total from all of last season. Michael Lee had 19 points and 10 rebounds for St. Bonaventure (6-14, 0-6), while Tyler Relph added 13 points and Matt Morgan had 10. The Bonnies dropped their sixth straight game and 12th in a row on the road, dating back to the final game of last season. They are 0-11 on the road this season. La Salle was 13-of-21 from 3-point territory in the first half and cruised to a 50-33 lead at the break. The Explorers then scored the first eight points of the second half to take a commanding 57-33 advantage. They converted a season-high 16 3-pointers and wound up 16-of-28. La Salle has now won six of its last seven games against St. Bonaventure, which shot just 39 percent from the field with 20 turnovers. The Bonnies, the last remaining Atlantic 10 team without a victory, are 3-33 in conference games on the road since the 2003-04 season.
